articles.description: From playing against him in the Under-19s World Cup to bowling to him in Test cricket, ex-England bowler Steven Finn reflects on Virat Kohli's genius.
articles.title: Virat Kohli retires: Steven Finn on India cricket legend's legacy on and off field

articles.description: Carlo Ancelotti will be in charge for Brazil at the 2026 World Cup. Can he fix their problems before then?
articles.title: Carlo Ancelotti appointed Brazil manager: Can he fix the Selecao?

articles.description: Ireland captain Caelan Doris faces a spell of four to six months on the sidelines after having surgery on a shoulder injury.
articles.title: Caelan Doris: Ireland captain ruled out for four to six months after surgery on shoulder

articles.description: Emma Raducanu's encouraging Italian Open run ends in the last 16 as Coco Gauff proves too much of a step up in class.
articles.title: Italian Open 2025: Emma Raducanu loses to Coco Gauff in Rome fourth round

articles.description: Following Manchester United's seventh match without a win, BBC Sport takes a look at how United have fared under Ruben Amorim.
articles.title: Manchester United: The stats behind Ruben Amorim's tenure

articles.description: The Indian Premier League (IPL) is making plans to resume, with a revised schedule released in the coming days.
articles.title: IPL resumption: Indian Premier League expected to resume in coming days

articles.description: As trailblazing jockey Rachael Blackmore retires from the saddle, we look at her impact and success in jump racing.
articles.title: Rachael Blackmore: How pioneering Grand National-winning jockey changed horse racing

articles.description: Australia might relax their preference for fielding Australian-based players to give themselves the best shot of beating the British and Irish Lions this summer.
articles.title: British and Irish Lions: Australia could relax preference for home-based players

articles.description: World number one Jannik Sinner continues his return from a doping ban with a comfortable 6-4 6-2 victory over Jesper de Jong to reach the last 16 of the Italian Open.
articles.title: Italian Open: Jannik Sinner cruises past Jesper de Jong to reach last 16

articles.description: Rugby concussions lawsuit: 'Every position affected' says claim data
articles.title: Rugby concussions lawsuit: 'Every position affected' says claim data
